ec34185c-51c8-4cd6-9622-c2160d850c12.description: Students who are awarded this badge are part of LEAP: Learning Enrichment and Advancement Program. The Passion Project is shared with the school community at the completion of each school year.

f0dcb564-ce7a-435c-99fa-e9fea05c47b8.description: A student leadership day designed to energise, engage, and empower student leaders. Impact By Design Masterclass will explore the five areas of high impact leadership. This includes intention, mind state, physical state, accountability, courage, and teamwork. Student Leaders will participate in a five-hour workshop facilitated by Meg Durham in coordination with Deputy Principal of Learning and Pastoral Care.
f0dcb564-ce7a-435c-99fa-e9fea05c47b8.name: Impact by Design

badge_template_activities.title: Students will master the art of mentoring.
Students will enhance their active listening skills based on restorative practices.
Students will develop their communication and collaboration skills.

f538a308-c397-4c32-8eca-1f25a093b1a4.description: Student Leaders will develop a sense of Catholic Identity and Mission and will learn to lead with a Marist Heart. They will focus on the art of mentoring, active listening based on restorative practices and communication skills. Student Leaders will participate in a four-hour workshop facilitated by Br Tony Leon FMS in coordination with Deputy Principal of Learning and Pastoral Care. This workshop will also involve collaboration with the student leaders from Lavalla Catholic College Traralgon.
f538a308-c397-4c32-8eca-1f25a093b1a4.name: Marist Student Leaders

badge_template_activities.title: Students will master the art of mentoring.

84bcd209-45b3-4c38-9654-26954fe8530f.description: Teachers attend and engage in a Professional Learning Activity for 1.5 hours. Teachers learn how to access PAT data, identify areas for improvement and how to target teaching activities to these areas.
84bcd209-45b3-4c38-9654-26954fe8530f.name: Professional Learning : PAT Data Literacy

alignments.name: AITSL Teaching Standards
alignments.description: 5.4 Interpret student data : Demonstrate the capacity to interpret student assessment data to evaluate student learning and modify teaching practice

badge_template_activities.title: Teachers can access PAT data and can state the areas of challenge identified in the data. Teachers are able use the data to inform their teaching practice.

ff1c789c-674f-483d-9831-47751391085c.description: Our Year 12 Applied Learning Students participated in a Community Service Day at the Exodus Community in West Heidelberg. The day included an informative tour of the neighbourhood including many sites of the 1956 Olympic Village. The students also assisted with the Drop-In Lunch serving meals to over forty residents and coordinated the Bread Run ministry delivering necessary supplies to over twenty families in need.
ff1c789c-674f-483d-9831-47751391085c.name: VCE VM Community Service Activity

badge_template_activities.title: Students volunteered their time to participate in this activity

ae50d0c6-a334-4929-b3b5-b67a0ea22283.description: This task is an extension for students who submit high quality work for the Festival Task and complete this additional project voluntarily.
ae50d0c6-a334-4929-b3b5-b67a0ea22283.name: Japanese Festival Recipe

badge_template_activities.title: Completion of the recipe template, including title and ingredients in both Japanese and English, picture, description and method in English.
Independent research into a Japanese recipe.
Writing in Japanese script.
Summarising the history and creation of a traditional Japanese food.

c7f84d13-a873-4b9a-9e65-67b1694b1b30.description: This course gives metalwork and woodwork teachers the knowledge and skills to safely operate a range of wood and/or metalwork machinery and to teach their students those methods. It also trains these teachers to undertake basic, preventative machinery maintenance in a safe manner.
c7f84d13-a873-4b9a-9e65-67b1694b1b30.name: Safe Use of Machinery for Technology Teaching

badge_template_activities.title: Completion of the four-day training program.

skills.name: Apply safe work practices involving machines used in technology teaching
Perform safe work operations involving metal working machines used in technology teaching
Perform safe work operations involving wood working machines used in technology teaching

57b92fb1-1889-4210-a369-e8eabbf052a5.description: This task requires students to select a chapter or scene from the movie or novel they are studying in class and re-write it from another character's perspective. Students needs to be consistent with their understanding of that particular character, including how they talk, move and think. Writing also needs to be descriptive by incorporating figurative language throughout. Writing needs to be grammatically correct and be edited by the student to ensure it is of a high standard.
57b92fb1-1889-4210-a369-e8eabbf052a5.name: Creating Texts

badge_template_activities.title: - Experiments with text structures and language features and their effects when writing.
- Creates literary texts that adapt stylistic features encountered in other texts..
- Plans, drafts and publishes imaginative texts, selecting subject, particular language, visual, and audio features to convey information and ideas to a specific audience.
- Edits for meaning by removing repetition, refining ideas, reordering sentences and by adding or omitting words for dramatic effect

b8b49907-e9b9-409b-bc01-23d071bf9d72.description: Middle leaders will explore and deepen their leadership capabilities within the Catholic schooling context, as well as mapping their professional and vocational growth as educators. Middle leaders will build upon their understanding of teaching and leading in a Marist school.
b8b49907-e9b9-409b-bc01-23d071bf9d72.name: Marist Middle Leaders

badge_template_activities.title: Heads of House will complete the two-day program.

9033e1cd-c1ed-428c-ad86-04cdf7206817.description: Students have demonstrated a fundamental skill in the field of chemistry.
9033e1cd-c1ed-428c-ad86-04cdf7206817.name: Science : Balancing Equations

badge_template_activities.title: Demonstrate the law of conservation of mass, by balancing chemical equations.

31698a18-4606-4773-a59c-1b17d199c777.description: Plan, rehearse and deliver a debate presentation with two other students. Each student in the group is required to select and sequence appropriate content, which reflects diversity of viewpoints. Students are required to use their voice and language conventions to persuade an audience.
31698a18-4606-4773-a59c-1b17d199c777.name: Speaking and Listening - Debate performance

badge_template_activities.title: Planning which was undertaken in groups.
Research of the issue.Construction of arguments and use of evidence to further each of these arguments.
Rehearsal of debate presentation.Listen to the opposing team's key arguments and rebut each of them during the debate.
Variation in tone and pitch to create meaning. Use of gestures to engage and audience.

a9be129d-7eb5-4657-870f-13185eb058ec.description: A mémoire is a literary genre within the class of autobiography. Students are required to choose a character from the novel and a significant point in the text. The student's presentation should reflect the chosen character’s thoughts, feelings and memories about this significant moment. Students then choose a form to adopt as they present these mémoires to other students in the year level.
a9be129d-7eb5-4657-870f-13185eb058ec.name: 'The Giver' text study: Creative Memoire Task and Presentation

badge_template_activities.title: Students must demonstrate a sophisticated and insightful understanding of their chosen character. This understanding should reflect a complex knowledge of the text and the message of the author. Students should be able to confidently refer to a range of important events in the text as they demonstrate this knowledge of the character. A creative and thoughtful presentation was completed for a group of students.

4de34b26-f2d0-49de-a265-63003b7d9a54.description: This program will provide the basic skills to deliver practical food studies classes safely and correctly. The workshop will cover everything from cooking demonstrations, to kitchen hazards, kitchen classroom operation and class timing. It will also be an opportunity to share teaching tips and to work collegiality to share ideas and lesson plans and update curriculum and resources.
4de34b26-f2d0-49de-a265-63003b7d9a54.name: Upskill to Food Technology Teaching

badge_template_activities.title: The teaching staff will complete a two-day program facilitated by Trainer: Hannah Smith.

45c6bfd6-c5a7-4a7a-8de8-1c8496e35278.description: This project is available to Year 8,9 and 10 students. Students choose a focus such as : historical fiction of figures, sustainability, classic novel, novels about other worlds, Futuristic novels. Students come up with a focus question to investigate.
45c6bfd6-c5a7-4a7a-8de8-1c8496e35278.name: Reading Expansion

badge_template_activities.title: Presentation of how their reading has expanded over time through reading and demonstrating knowledge from up to fifteen books. Possible areas for improvement include vocabulary work, harder content and context, adult ideas if relevant. Explain all about the types of novels that you have read.

skills.name: Evaluate and integrate ideas and information from texts to form their own interpretations.
Locating suitable novels to show research skills and extend reading ability.
Select evidence from the text to analyse and explain how language choices and conventions are used to influence an audience

04d8f407-d185-478a-8c22-7f30c98d3366.description: Marist Sion students completed Barista Training at Bean Scene Around in Warragul. A Barista is a trained professional with knowledge and experience in the art of coffee making using a variety of commercial machines and grinders.
04d8f407-d185-478a-8c22-7f30c98d3366.name: Barista Badge

badge_template_activities.title: Sound knowledge of what they are serving including where ingredients come from and how the are prepared
An understanding of the contributing factors of creating an espresso to be able to manipulate chemistry to consistently extract perfection.
An understanding of textured milk and how to pour it.
An understanding how to clean and maintain equipment, including a thorough understanding of the coffee machine, grinder and barista tools so as to avoid misuse and damage.

cb2656df-bc8c-41ff-9a64-bcc82f2f0519.description: Student must submit a scientific report (any format is acceptable as long as the scientific method is followed) of an original investigation conducted in their own time.

badge_template_activities.title: Students will have defined a question, developed a hypothesis and conducted experiments to test this hypothesis in their own time. They will then have communicated their results and conclusions in an appropriate manner.
